edit target content:
The AI chip and supercomputer supply chain involves advanced manufacturing, packaging, assembly, and rigorous testing processes. NVIDIA collaborates with industry leaders Amkor and SPIL for packaging and testing operations based in Arizona.

Over the next four years, NVIDIA is committed to investing up to $500 billion in U.S.-based AI infrastructure. Partnering with key players such as TSMC, Foxconn, Wistron, Amkor, and SPIL, these initiatives aim to enhance NVIDIA’s global footprint, unlock new business opportunities, and strengthen supply chain resilience.
content after edit: AI Chip and Supply Chain Overview

The supply chain of AI chips and supercomputers encompasses advanced manufacturing, packaging, assembly, and comprehensive testing procedures. NVIDIA partners with industry leaders Amkor and SPIL, who conduct packaging and testing operations in Arizona.

NVIDIA plans to invest up to $500 billion in U.S.-based AI infrastructure over the next four years. Collaborating with major partners such as TSMC, Foxconn, Wistron, Amkor, and SPIL, these efforts are designed to expand NVIDIA’s global presence, uncover new business opportunities, and reinforce supply chain resilience.

edit target content:
The AI chip and supercomputer supply chain involves advanced manufacturing, packaging, assembly, and rigorous testing processes. NVIDIA collaborates with industry leaders Amkor and SPIL for packaging and testing operations based in Arizona.

Over the next four years, NVIDIA is committed to investing up to $500 billion in U.S.-based AI infrastructure. Partnering with key players such as TSMC, Foxconn, Wistron, Amkor, and SPIL, these initiatives aim to enhance NVIDIA’s global footprint, unlock new business opportunities, and strengthen supply chain resilience.
content after edit: AI Chip and Supply Chain Overview

The AI chip and supercomputer supply chain encompasses advanced manufacturing, sophisticated packaging, precise assembly, and rigorous testing procedures. NVIDIA partners with industry leaders Amkor and SPIL, utilizing their Arizona facilities for packaging and testing operations.

In the next four years, NVIDIA plans to invest up to $500 billion in AI infrastructure across the U.S. Collaborations with key companies including TSMC, Foxconn, Wistron, Amkor, and SPIL are designed to expand NVIDIA’s global presence, create new business opportunities, and enhance the resilience of its supply chain.
